channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Unrepentant Nigel Farage breaks lockdown to watch migrants arriving at Dover
item.description: Mr Farage delivered a letter to Kent Police headquarters in Maidstone in which he said he was 'certain' the visit to his home was 'a very unwise use of officers' time and of public money'.

item.title: Donald Trump's White House Navy valet tests POSITIVE for coronavirus
item.description: A Navy official who acts as one of President Donald Trump's personal valets has tested positive for the coronavirus.

item.title: Carbon emissions are being detected from the moon
item.description: Carbon emissions from the moon are making scientists question the theory that the dusty rock was formed in a collision between the Earth and 'wandering planet' Theia.

item.title: Sweden admits a 'big failure' to prevent elderly deaths from coronavirus
item.description: Sweden's ambassador in the US, Karin Ulrika Olofsdotter, said 90 per cent of those who died in Sweden were over 70, meaning that around 2,700 elderly people have died of the virus.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Death toll with 30,615 with 539 new fatalities
item.description: Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab tonight described the growing number of COVID-19 fatalities as 'tragic'. He revealed 5,600 more Britons had tested positive for the deadly virus.

item.title: Locked-down smartphone users in the UK are sitting on unused mobile data worth £165 million
item.description: UK consumers stuck at home during lockdown are using a fraction of the data that they would usually, relying on home WiFi instead, comparison site Uswitch has reported.

item.title: TikTok video shows what celebrities would look like if their faces were perfectly symmetrical
item.description: Dr. Dustin Portela, an Idaho dermatologist, shared a TikTok video in which he showed what stars would look like if their faces had perfect symmetry.

item.title: New York City was the source of US outbreak, data shows
item.description: An analysis of genetic samples and travel history suggests COVID-19 started spreading from New York to other states weeks before lockdown measures were introduced.

item.title: Counter-terrorism sniffer dogs Mick and Mack are trained to root out destructive Japanese knotweed
item.description: Labrador retrievers Mack and Mick are thought to be the first dogs in the UK trained to sniff out Japanese knotweed in both homes and gardens and will freeze when they identify the plant.

item.title: 12,000 BA staff are 'paying with the jobs', Unite union says
item.description: British Airways could resume flights at 50 per cent capacity as early as this summer, but bosses have warned it could take up to three years for passenger numbers to recover.
item.media:description: British Airways planes grounded due to the coronavirus outbreak are parked at Gatwick Airport in Sussex (PA) (Gareth Fuller / PA)

item.title: Middle-aged people are suffering almost 20 per cent more stress than two decades ago, study shows
item.description: The root of the problem lies in the 'generational squeeze' of having dependent parents on one side and grown-up children struggling to start a career on the other, US researchers found.

item.title: Former Goldman Sachs COO's daughter, 28, in court charged with attacking him at £2.6m mansion
item.description: Saskia Pot, 28, hit her father Wiet Pot, who has an estimated net worth of one billion euros, at her £2.6million home in Richmond, London. Her mother, a psychiatrist, said she was 'scared' of her.

item.title: Inside the Alpine hotel where the King of Thailand is spending lockdown
item.description: King Maha Vajiralongkorn, 67, is believed to be back at the four-star retreat in southern Germany (pictured) after returning from brief visits back to Thailand.

item.title: Mrs Hinch reveals the dirt and grime lurking in her tumble dryer along with cleaning tips
item.description: The Essex-based cleaning sensation, 30, whose real name is Sophie Hinchcliffe, gave her machine some much needed TLC in a video shared to her Instagram Stories yesterday.

item.title: Thieves steal 80,000 protective facemasks intended for NHS and care home workers
item.description: Greater Manchester Police said they are hunting for the perpetrators , in what they described as a 'particularly sickening crime' given the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Mob of officers descend on park to fine youths who tormented lone PCSO
item.description: The brazen moment a PCSO's bike was taken as he tried to disperse the mob in Slough was captured on video. Further footage shows officers flocking to the scene to fine the youths.

item.title: Kitten lures playful dog into pet pen and shuts him in before slipping out between the rails
item.description: Cheeto the kitten outsmarted an English Mastiff Larry after Larry wanted to play but Cheeto was not in a playful mood. Cheeto locked him in a pet pen at their home in Fort Worth, Texas.

item.title: The European flag quiz that only 10% of Britons could score full marks on
item.description: The fastest time that the quiz has been completed in is 1 minute 36 seconds, while the average is 2 minutes 12 seconds. Over two out of three people couldn't identify the flag for Belgium... see if you can.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: No10 says social distancing remains in place this weekend
item.description: Dominic Raab tonight announced there is 'no change' yet to the UK's coronavirus lockdown rules as he urged Britons not to take advantage of sunny bank holiday weather.

item.title: Big nap and fries: Adorable moment toddler struggles to stay awake as he eats his dinner
item.description: Toddler Conor Rees was finishing a meal of fries, chicken nuggets and beans at home in Dublin, Ireland when he was struck by a bout of tiredness.

item.title: Government urged to slash 'too generous' furlough payments to some workers to kick-start economy
item.description: IFS chief Paul Johnson acknowledged there was an 'incredibly difficult and fine judgment' to be made as some sectors of the economy were unlikely to ever fully recover but others could be restarted.

item.title: Specsavers eye doctor, 50, is suspended 22 YEARS after being arrested for streaking with friends
item.description: Optometrist Jagdip Dhariwal, 50, from Romsey, Hampshire, failed to tell the optical regulation authority about his arrest. He streaked outside his house with friends while he was at university.

item.title: Japanese honeybees COOK invading 'murder hornets' to death
item.description: Murderous Asian hornets are invading honeybee hives- decapitating the insects and feeding the bodies to their young. But Japanese bees are fighting back by cooking the predators to death.

item.title: Boris Johnson's Covid-19 lockdown exit plan explained in full
item.description: The proposals are to be split into five stages over the coming months, and a leaked version of the plan has suggested the first changes on Monday will see unlimited exercise allowed.

item.title: Forged £50 note made by the Nazis to destabilise the British economy during WWII goes up for auction
item.description: The £50 note, bearing the signature of Chief Cashier 'B.S. Catterns', was made as part of Operation Bernhard - a scheme dreamt up by Adolf Hitler to destabilise the economy in Britain.

item.title: Travellers flout social distancing rules as crowds flock to gypsy funeral despite warnings
item.description: Travellers turned out in huge numbers to attend a funeral in Thornaby, North Yorkshire, in defiance of social distancing measures meant to prevent the spread of coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Nations hit hardest had most international travel
item.description: Brazilian researchers found nations hit hardest by the killer disease were ones accepting the most international flights. It may explain why the US (73,431) and UK (30,150) have the most deaths.

item.title: Dr Foster remake is South Korea's biggest-ever TV drama
item.description: The story of adultery has gripped a nation where cheating on a spouse was illegal just five years ago.

item.title: Unruly tourist forces a peacock to pose for a picture with her
item.description: Social media footage from Monday shows the woman pinning down the peacock for a snap as the distressed animal struggles to get away at Yunnan Safari Park in south-eastern China.

item.title: Seven in 10 say people should be able to REFUSE to go back to work
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Research for MailOnline shows 62 per cent are more worried about the effects of the draconian curbs ending too early, while 38 per cent say their main concern is the economic havoc now.

item.title: Social worker arrested on suspicion of sexual activity with a child as part of probe into gang
item.description: His arrest follows the launch of Operation Green Jacket last May, an investigation into child exploitation during 2004 and 2005 which included a fresh probe into the abuse Victoria Agoglia aged 15.

item.title: Chinese scenic spot unveils 'the world's largest swing' which stands 30 storeys tall
item.description: A Chinese scenic spot has built a huge swing on the edge of a 2,300-foot-tall cliff and is planning to apply for the world record of the largest swing. The swing is roughly the height of a 30-storey building.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Lockdown is perfect time to lose weight
item.description: Professor Susan Jebb, of Oxford University, urged Brits to stop buying junk food and only have healthy food in their house, and told them to exercise to avoid the temptation of the biscuit tin.

item.title: Microsoft unveils Xbox Series X gameplay and new 'badge' for when games run best on the console
item.description: In a live-streamed event on Thursday the gaming titan showcased in-engine gameplay of several upcoming titles for the Series X, Microsoft's upcoming next-generation console.

item.title: US Government DID know about coup Venezuela plot: DEA and Homeland Security received tip on Goudreau
item.description: An informant gave the DEA a tip off about Jordan Goudreau's alleged weapons smuggling in Columbia earlier this year, a report said.

item.title: Author is accused of racism over comments about Meghan Markle
item.description: Emily Giffin, 48, the author of the 2005 international bestseller Something Borrowed, made the comments on her Instagram account on Wednesday.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Thousands queue for hours at Birmingham dumps
item.description: Drivers queued for hours outside rubbish dumps in Birmingham today after the waste contractor Veolia opened four of its five waste sites in the city for the first time in seven weeks.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Black people 'FOUR TIMES more likely to die'
item.description: Government statisticians analysed the number of all COVID-19-related fatalities in England and Wales between March 2 and April 10 and found the risk for some ethnic groups was 'significantly higher'.

item.title: Illegal migrant 'rapes Italian coronavirus nurse, 48'
item.description: The migrant from Senegal was arrested on Sunday for allegedly raping the 48-year-old after she left work at a Naples hospital at around 3pm. It happened at the Corso Arnaldo Lucci Metropark bus stop.

item.title: Queen pays glowing tribute to newspapers for using their platform to help others during Covid crisis
item.description: The Queen thanked national titles and broadcasters alongside local and regional outlets today for their work during the coronavirus crisis, as part of a campaign called 'Thankful Thursday'.

item.title: Opera singer's performances to cheer up village during lockdown can be heard THREE miles away
item.description: Tenor John Hudson lives in Dorset's Piddle Valley and its natural acoustics help carry his booming voice across the countryside when he sings every Thursday at 6pm.

item.title: Council is accused of wasting taxpayers money by painting 'Thank you NHS' messages on roads
item.description: Swindon Borough Council has come under fire after it took to social media to reveal that its Highways Team had painted a 'thank you' message to NHS staff amid the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Gambling addict mother says she's being 'bombarded' with online ads during lock-down
item.description: Recovering gambling addict Kelly Field, 36, from Merseyside, who spent £500 a day at her lowest point, told the BBC she feels she's being 'bombarded' with online ads for betting sites.

item.title: Friendship between British and Kiwi Lancaster Bomber war heroes discovered 75 years after they died
item.description: Alison Round, 54, of Staplehurst, Kent, found a Bible belonging to Morgan Swap, a New Zealand (NZ) flight sergeant in her uncle Edward Finch's belongings and travelled to NZ to return it to his family.

item.title: Sprawling manor once owned by Adventures of Robin Hood star Richard Greene goes on sale for £2.9m
item.description: Matinee idol Richard Greene bought the property in Inch, Gorey, Wexford in 1963. During his stay, the Georgian house played host to Elizabeth Taylor, Cary Grant and Richard Burton.

item.title: Coronavirus patients lie next to dead bodies in Indian hospital as new infections continue to rise
item.description: According to posts on social media, the hospital shown in the video is Mumbai's Lokmanya Tilak Hospital, in the Sion district which is in the heart of the city which has over 18 million residents.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Notting Hill Carnival is cancelled
item.description: Planners of the famous event, held each year in the streets of Notting Hill in London, say the decision has been taken to cancel this year's event due to the Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 10% parents happy to send kids back to school
item.description: A quarter of parents said the would feel comfortable with a September return date if it was confirmed now, while 7 per cent favoured July, according to data from the survey by charity Parentkind.

item.title: Normal People star Paul Mescal is stunned as James Corden reveals the BBC drama 'changed my life'
item.description: the Normal People star, 24, who plays Connell Waldren was left stunned on Thursday as James Corden revealed on Twitter that the Sally Rooney adaptation 'changed my life'.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: NHS workers slammed over TikTok coffin dance
item.description: North West Ambulance Service issued a statement saying that the coronavirus-related video breached their social media policy after racking up thousands of views online.

item.title: Repurposing drugs to treat COVID-19 will allow tackle the pandemic faster than developing a vaccine
item.description: Any effective vaccine will take over a year to be developed and ready to be brought to bear on the coronavirus outbreak on a large scale, the UK-led team argued.

item.title: Coronavirus Italy: Beaches open as lockdown eased
item.description: Italians have been pictured socially distancing at the beach and shopping at markets in masks as they adjust to a 'new normal' after one of the strictest coronavirus lockdowns in Europe was eased.

item.title: Duchess of Cambridgeappears on This Morning after joining forces with National Portrait Gallery
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge has appeared on ITV's This Morning today to discuss her new project with the National Portrait Gallery, and gave a glimpse at how George and Charlotte are coping.

item.title: Terminally ill: Christine Meaney, 60, and Desmond Codona, 59, get married own home
item.description: Christine Meaney, 60, and Desmond Codona, 59, who live in Hemlington, Middlesbrough, married at their home, after Desmond was told that he could have just weeks to live.

item.title: How chlorinated chicken STILL has bacteria on it
item.description: Dr Callum Highmore, a Research Fellow in Microbiology at Southampton University told Channel 5's Secrets of Your Supermarket Shop of the dangers of chlorinated chicken.

item.title: Coronavirus: International media asks how UK failed so badly
item.description: The world's media has lined up to savage Britain's coronavirus response this week after the UK's death toll surpassed Italy's to become the worst in Europe.

item.title: Mexican senator apologizes after his pregnant daughter hired a helicopter to reveal baby's gender
item.description: Mexico state senator Gerardo Novelo Osuna apologized for his daughter Ivanna Novelo Müller's decision to host a gender reveal party at a beach in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic.

item.title: Spanish beaches will rope off zones to enforce social distancing in some areas this summer
item.description: In order to be able to have tourists return to the area, the council of the north-western Sanxenxo municipality in Spain has devised a way to enforce social distancing on its beaches.

item.title: UK Weather: 26C heatwave predicted before lockdown ends
item.description: Tomorrow will see the mercury hitting up to 79F (26C) in London with conditions staying warm on Saturday, before a stark change on Sunday as Arctic air hits the UK, says the Met Office.

item.title: How having a happy-sound street name can increase your home's value by nearly £25,000
item.description: Properties with adjectives like 'chipper' and 'gay' in the address are wroth more then those on neighbouring roads, according to data from British financial advice website Bankrate.

item.title: 'Healthy' 21-year-old reveals how coronavirus attacked her vital organs
item.description: Lily Burns, 21, from Fort Williams, tno health conditions when she caught coronavirus, and told BBC's Good Morning Scotland how it attacked her organs and left her fighting for her life.

item.title: Father-of-three died after being stabbed in heart with a kitchen knife following fight, court hears
item.description: Kieron Nicholson, 29, is accused of killing Jamie Simmons (pictured), also 29, following a confrontation outside a block of flats in Maidstone, Kent, on Monday evening, May 4.

item.title: Thousands of commuters gear up to return to work on Underground
item.description: Emergency planners have already been warned London's transport system could be overwhelmed by demand when the coronavirus lockdown is eased in some form.

item.title: NHSX Covid-19 contact tracing app doesn't work on two-year-old phones
item.description: Residents on the Isle of Wight today claim they are unable to use the new NHS contact tracing app on phones which are more than two years old.

item.title: Fury as leaked report says Government warned over 'insufficient' pandemic plans three YEARS ago
item.description: Experts warned in 2017 that demand for services would outstrip capacity and outlined the problems facing care homes in the face of a highly contagious disease outbreak.

item.title: Gay couple furious as Sainsbury's staff workers separate them while shopping
item.description: A man vented his fury at staff workers in a Sainsbury's store after they told him he could not shop with his boyfriend due to social distancing rules.

item.title: Garden fire insurance claims treble during lockdown as families enjoy more barbecues
item.description: Insurance giant Admiral said garden fire claims had surged since 2018, and now accounted for almost two fifths of all fire claims. A home in Bolton lost its roof after a fire burned out of control (left).

item.title: Russian billionaire who played ice hockey with Putin is found shot dead
item.description: Dmitry Bosov, 52, one of the richest men in Russia, was found dead from a gunshot wound to the head inside the private gym of his mansion in Moscow on Wednesday night.

item.title: FTSE 100 opens up as investors welcome easing of lockdown
item.description: London was also underpinned by a weaker pound after the Bank of England held rates and kept its stimulus package unchanged, even as it predicted more gloom for the British economy.

item.title: Richard Pusey will apply for bail following involvement in crash which saw four police officers die
item.description: Richard Pusey, 41, has submitted his bail application which will be heard at the Melbourne Magistrates' Court on Monday.
item.media:credit: Joe Sabljak for Daily Mail Australia

item.title: England rugby star Billy Vunipola flouts Covid-19 social distancing rules for a coffee in the sun
item.description: Vunipola, who has been capped 45 times by England, and his Saracens team mates met up for coffee and a chat in St Albans and failed to observe social distancing rules.

item.title: Mental health nurse, 31, who didn't know she was pregnant, gave birth to a 5lb 8oz daughter
item.description: Emma Hindmarsh, 31, from Sunderland, Tyne and Wear, gave birth to daughter Isabelle Rose, weighing 5lb 8oz, with the help of her husband Daniel, 34, in their bedroom.

item.title: EU claims UK not trying to make a success of Brexit trade talks
item.description: The EU's Trade Commissioner Phil Hogan said there had only been 'very slow progress' in the talks to date.

item.title: Wearing of face masks compulsory at three major airports
item.description: While passengers are encouraged to bring their own masks and gloves, equipment will be provided for those arriving without in the early stages of the trial scheme.

item.title: Europe's invasive warty comb jellyfish eats its own offspring
item.description: The cannibalistic animal in question is a species called Mnemiopsis leidyi, which is also known as the warty comb jelly. It regularly washes up on Baltic shores.

item.title: Death toll among NHS and healthcare staff hits 150
item.description: Tributes continue to flood in for those who have lost their lives on the frontline, as Boris Johnson prepares to announce an easing of lockdown restrictions on Sunday.

item.title: Boxing champion has to reassure friends he is still alive
item.description: Rhys McCole, from Greenock, took to social media last night to confirm he was still alive after BBC News Scotland falsely reported on his death.

item.title: People smuggler jailed for two years after 10 months on run
item.description: Adam Raynor was initially arrested at the French terminal of the Channel Tunnel in June 2019 after the Chinese and Vietnamese nationals were found in the back of his car.

item.title: Humans were brewing beer in central Europe 6,000 years ago
item.description: Neolithic humans in central Europe may have been brewing beer 6,000 years ago, according to scientists who have developed a new method to analyse grains.

item.title: Britons make their final preparations ahead of the 75th anniversary of VE Day tomorrow
item.description: Thousands up and down the country are set to take part in celebrations for VE Day which marks the moment WWII ended in Europe On May 8, 1945.

item.title: Gary Neville says clubs at the bottom of the Premier League will get 'BULLIED'
item.description: The three teams occupying the Premier League's bottom three places have been warned that relegation could be imposed on them if they continue to obstruct plans to resume the season.

item.title: Norway mosque shooter apologises 'for not causing MORE harm'
item.description: On the first day of his trial today in Oslo, Philip Manshaus, 22, said that the incident last August was an act of 'emergency justice'. He denied charges of murder and terror read to him by a prosecutor.
item.media:description: Defendant Philip Manshaus appears in court on charges of murder and terrorism in Olso, Norway, Thursday May, 7, 2020. Manshaus suspected of killing his stepsister and then storming an Oslo mosque with firearms "with the intention to kill as many Muslims as possible," has appeared in court, charged with murder and terror. Philip Manshaus has denied the charges. (Lise Åserud / NTB scanpix via AP)

item.title: Language students face a 'virtual year abroad' learning over the Internet
item.description: A 'virtual year abroad' is currently being explored by the University Council of Modern Languages (UCML), with dozens of Higher Education institutions taking part in preliminary discussions.

item.title: Model ditches the catwalk as she MOVES into her local care home
item.description: Harriet Rose, who is signed to top London agency Select, took to her Instagram page to explain that she's working with residents at an unnamed care home in Herne Bay, Kent.

item.title: Mother, 29, appears in court accused of murdering churchwarden in Co-op supermarket knife attac
item.description: A mother appeared in court on Thursday accused of killing a churchwarden and trying to kill three other shoppers in a knife attack at a Co-op supermarket in Rhondda.

item.title: Code breaker, 100, talks about World War II at Bletchley Park
item.description: Anne, Lady Jaffray, 100, told Tatler how she used to juggle her top secret work deciphering German Enigma codes with nights off dancing with 'dashing officers' at London hotspots.

item.title: Woman with severe OCD reveals how she eats breakfast in eye-opening video
item.description: Ashley Dawson, 26, was formally diagnosed with obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) seven years ago but has been experiencing symptoms since childhood.

item.title: Why does Adele's face look SO different after weight loss?
item.description: A series of top aesthetic experts have suggested a variety of reasons for why Adele's face looks so different following her seven-stone weight loss - including possible non-invasive treatments.

item.title: Billionaire inventor Sir James Dyson ditches plan to build waterfall and expand lake on his estate
item.description: Historic England raised concerns that the waterfall wouldn't fit into the naturalised landscape setting, adding that enlarging the lake would result in the loss of a lawn at the Dodington Estate.

item.title: Coronavirus: Study suggests staying at home had little effect
item.description: The University of East Anglia team say relaxing stay-at-home orders and letting some businesses reopen could be the UK's first step to easing lockdown.

item.title: More than six million Brits are worried about friends' drinking habits during lockdown, survey finds
item.description: Boredom, loneliness and anxiety are all major reasons why Brits have been hitting the bottle over the last two months, research by YouGov for drug and alcohol charity We Are With You claims.

item.title: Warburtons unveils its secret crumpet recipe so you can recreate the baked treat at home
item.description: Warburtons has unveiled the recipe for its popular crumpets, and all you need is plain flour, salt, sugar, baking powder and dried yeast - as well as a metal biscuit cutter, reports Metro.

item.title: Coronavirus: Recovered patients could provide 'shield immunity'
item.description: Researchers from Georgia Institute of Technology say the recovered patients would be more active and mobile than those who have remained uninfected.

item.title: Bad Company singer Brian Anthony Howe dead at 66 due to cardiac arrest
item.description: TMZ reported on Tuesday morning that the talented musician passed away at his home in Florida while possibly on his way to the hospital according to a relative.

item.title: Elite school embroiled in child sex scandal after a board member was charged over 'abhorrent' videos
item.description: Perth Modern School's Craig Andrew Donovan, 56, has been charged after officers allegedly uncovered child abuse videos on his mobile phone and desktop computer.

item.title: Marilyn Monroe lookalike who lives in the late star's home shares video tours of Hollywood mansion
item.description: Jasmine Chiswell, 25, from Lanarkshire, Scotland, lives in the home of the Hollywood star Marilyn Monroe and has revealed on TikTok some of the discoveries she's made in the late icon's home.

item.title: Being obese may DOUBLE the risk of needing hospital treatment for the life-threatening coronavirus
item.description: Scientists in Glasgow trawled over data for more than 428,000 people who were part of the UK Biobank. Some 340 of those had recently tested positive for COVID-19 in hospital.

item.title: Columbia road house which appeared in Luther, Call the Midwife and fashion photoshoots goes on sale
item.description: Sally Bett, reaveled she put her two-bedroom flat near Colombia Road in East London on the market after years of buyers begging her to sell it, but now she can't shift the property.

item.title: China bans cities from building skyscrapers taller than 1,640 feet
item.description: China has forbidden all cities from erecting towers taller than 500 metres (1,640 feet) except in 'special' circumstances. The construction of those taller than 250 metres (820 feet) will be 'strictly limited'.

item.title: What car making in a coronavirus era looks like for Aston Martin
item.description: From temperature tests on arrival to face masks and two-metre distancing, this is the first glimpse of how manufacturing in Britain could look in the wake of the lockdown.

item.title: Walt Disney's 'Technicolor Dream House' goes on the market for $1m
item.description: The quirky property in Palm Springs, California, was built for the famous entrepreneur and animator in 1962 and became known as his 'Technicolor Dream House'.

item.title: Walt Disney's 'Technicolor Dream House' goes on the market for $1m
item.description: The quirky property in Palm Springs, California, was built for the famous entrepreneur and animator in 1962 and became known as his 'Technicolor Dream House'.

item.title: Bike shops are running out of stock as stores struggle to meet demand in lockdown sales boom
item.description: Halfords, Decathlon, Evans and Wheelbase are all listing some models of mountain and road bikes as out of stock on their websites. Surge in sales comes as Britons prepare for post-lockdown life.

item.title: Britons urged not to buy miracle coronavirus cures online
item.description: The UK drug watchdog said there'd been a surge in bogus cleansing oils and sprays appearing online. It warned these products 'pose a risk to health' and could make COVID-19 infection worse.

item.title: NHS Heroes: Fighting to Save Our Lives viewers left 'heartbroken' following 'eyeopening' documentary
item.description: Viewers were left heartbroken following last night's powerful Channel 4 documentary NHS Heroes: Fighting to Save Our Lives, which showed the realities for NHS staff working on the frontline.

item.title: Mallorca's hotel industry plans to welcome foreign tourists from July
item.description: Germans and Austrians will be among the first allowed back to the holiday hot spot before Britons, as hoteliers enter into discussions with German tourist companies.

item.title: Cruise ship dancer couple break down as they reveal they've been stranded on a ship in the Bahamas
item.description: Lauren Carrick, 29, from Norwich, and her dancer fiance Joseph Harrison, 27, from Hull are on the Celebrity Infinity ship alongside around 900 other crew members, and have been stranded.

item.title: Airbnb landlord looks on in horror as doorbell CCTV shows 12 revellers sneaking into his flat
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The landlord said he received a booking for the apartment in Notting Hill, London at around 9pm on April 18, and warned that only two people could be inside the property at once.

item.title: Britons have downloaded 125 per cent more online crosswords since coronavirus lockdown started
item.description: The top download category is crosswords and puzzles, up a huge 125 per cent. Content for children is in second place, showing an astronomical rise of over 100 per cent.

item.title: Super 'Flower' Moon set to make another appearance tonight
item.description: Stunning images from the UK, Europe and the rest of the northern hemisphere reveal the dazzling celestial showcase as it provides an awe-inspiring backdrop to the world's most iconic locations.
item.media:description: The moon sets over a house in Bamburgh, Northumberland on Wednesday morning (Owen Humphreys/PA)

item.title: 15th-Century north Wales mansion where Kit Harrington threw his stag do goes on sale on £1.65m
item.description: Eriviat Hall, in Henllan, Denbigshire, Wales, has been designed to run as both a private home and a wedding venue as well as a house for rent, and has been put on the market for £1.65million.

item.title: Chinese school orders students to run two hours every day in 'weight-loss classes'
item.description: A video filmed Wednesday showed two rows of students running around the field track during 'weight-loss classes' at the Shuguang Bilingual School in Huai'an, Jiangsu province of eastern China.

item.title: New mother Grimes shows off her bare pregnancy bump for Vogue Italia cover shoot
item.description: Grimes gave birth to a baby boy with Tesla CEO Elon Musk earlier this week and the singer also appeared on the cover of Vogue Italia.

item.title: Normal People's Paul Mescal reveals shock at becoming an overnight heartthrob
item.description: The Normal People star, 24, discussed the reaction to the BBC series and his character Connell during a recent interview with Grazia magazine.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Airfares to rise over 50% with social distancing
item.description: The IATA says social distancing measures would shift the economics of aviation by slashing the maximum load factor to 62%, below the average industry 'breakeven load factor' of 77%.

item.title: The beautiful shortlisted images in Agora's photo contest themed on spring
item.description: Over 14,000 photos were submitted, with the entries in the final reckoning including pictures of flowers in Vietnam, a chick being fed in Bangladesh and a dreamy Tuscan landscape.

item.title: Positive COVID-19 tests for recovered patients are not reinfections, WHO says
item.description: People who test positive for coronavirus after already having been infected are not getting reinfected, according to the World Health Organisation (WHO).

item.title: Mosquitoes that can carry diseases could be common in Europe by 2030
item.description: The insect, known by the scientific name Aedes aegypti as well as the common name 'yellow fever mosquito', currently only thrives in the world's hottest regions.

item.title: Dogs destined to be EATEN in South Korea are saved following months spent in cages
item.description: An animal charity mission to save around 70 dogs from the meat farm in Hongseong finally got underway after Humane Society International worked with the farmer.

item.title: Pedestrian is flung across SUV's bonnet in shocking hit and run smash as he crosses a street
item.description: A pedestrian crosses a street but a blue Honda heads towards him at high speed. The man desperately steps to his side to avoid the car but is flung onto the bonnet and carried along.

item.title: North Korea is 'constructing giant storage area for its nuclear missiles'
item.description: North Korea is nearing completion on a new base near the capital of Pyongyang which could be used to increase and protect the country's stockpile of nuclear weapons, analysts say.
item.media:credit: MAXAR Technologies/ Center for Strategic and International Studies

item.title: Bank of England warns UK GDP will slump 14 PER CENT this year
item.description: In a grim assessment, the Bank said the economy could shrink by nearly 30 per cent in the first half of this year before recovering some ground.

item.title: Prince Harry's ex-girlfriend Cressida Bonas 'auto-weds' her fiancé Harry Wentworth-Stanley
item.description: Winchester-born actress Cressida Bonas, 30, shared an Instagram post as she and her fiancé Harry Wentworth-Stanley dressed up in bride and groom outfits in front of an Auto-wed machine.

item.title: Nearly one in four UK firms have halted trading due to coronavirus lockdown
item.description: The ONS said 23 per cent of businesses have temporarily closed or paused trading, according to its latest survey on the business impact of coronavirus.

item.title: BT scraps its dividend for at least 2 YEARS as it focuses on fibre broadband
item.description: Chief executive Philip Jansen, who recently recovered from Covid-19, said a new target of full fibre to 20 million homes by the mid to late 2020s is now in place.

item.title: Germany goes back to school: Pupils are shown how to social distance
item.description: Social distancing was the first lesson on the timetable in Dortmund this morning where pupils lined up at 5ft intervals in the playground.

item.title: Immigration removal centres nearly empty after authorities release 700 detainees
item.description: More than 700 detainees have been released from immigration centres up and down the UK, according to official figures revealed today.

item.title: Dramatic moment fire destroys two houses after 'almighty' explosion
item.description: This is the moment a huge fire ripped through two houses in a Hampshire village and sent manhole covers flying on Tuesday night.

item.title: Two men are charged over 'fake delivery burglary' at London house where boy, 11, was shot
item.description: Antony Lascelles, 32, from Romford, and Adian Muirhead, from South Ockendon, are due to appear at Barkingside Magistrates' Court on Thursday in connection with the incident.

item.title: Brandon Lewis blames 'a bit of an issue at the labs' for coronavirus testing falling by almost HALF
item.description: Northern Ireland Secretary Mr Lewis said 'a technical issue' was behind a 43 per cent fall in completed daily tests between last Thursday and yesterday, from 122,327 to 69,463.

item.title: Police seal off park in Kent after body of teenage boy is discovered
item.description: Officers were sent to Dunorlan Park, Tunbridge Wells in Kent along with paramedics, at around 5am following the discovery of the body.

item.title: Chinese girl, seven, has to study UNDER her parents' market counter every day
item.description: Touching images showed the little girl taking lessons online with her laptop and naked light bulbs in the confined space under the market stall in the outskirt of Yichang city, Hubei province.

item.title: Two drug dealers are jailed for 10 years in total after flooding town with heroin and cocaine
item.description: Llewellyn Campbell and Macauley Peacock were part of a gang that brought class A drugs from Manchester to Kilmarnock, Ayrshire, taking advantage of vulnerable addicts.

item.title: Prison officers will get £4,100 extra for doing nine hours a week more during Covid-19 crisis
item.description: Documents show Covid-19 'Special Payment Schemes' were introduced on March 23 to 'support prison and probation services and safeguard staff and offenders' through the pandemic.

item.title: War veteran Marjorie Lamb, 99, plans to do 100 laps in her garden
item.description: War veteran Marjorie Lamb, 99, from Scotland, who turns 100 on the 31st May, appeared on Good Morning Britain today, and vowed to get 'one up on the men' before her birthday.

item.title: Wuhan doctors save a critically ill coronavirus patient, 65, by giving him a double-lung transplant
item.description: The patient, named as Cui An, tested positive for COVID-19 in early February and had been hooked to a life-support machine for more than two months when surgeons performed the operation.

item.title: Bank is 'robbed' by a monkey in India
item.description: Police rushed to the scene of a suspected robbery at a bank ATM near India's presidential palace on Wednesday - only to discover the machine had been prized open by a curious monkey.

item.title: Newly surfaced video reveals how OPRAH could have gifted baby Archie his birthday books
item.description: The Duke, 35, and Duchess of Sussex, 38, are believed to have received the Duck! Rabbit! storybook for their son Archie as part of a gift from media mogul Oprah Winfrey, 66.

item.title: Flock of vultures swoop in to steal cheetah's kill before lion snatches it from them
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT. The group of vultures inch closer to the cheetah in Kruger National Park, South Africa. They take the kill but a lion steals it from them a few moments later.

item.title: 'Covidiot' former headteacher is slammed by parents after organising play-dates for her daughter
item.description: A former headteacher has been branded a 'selfish covidiot' for publicly bragging that she is inviting her pals over with their children for play-dates with her daughter.

item.title: Man causes a pile-up in an expressway tunnel in China
item.description: CCTV footage shows the man stop his car in the overtaking lane of the Qinyuanling tunnel, Zhejiang Province, China, causing a three-car pile up and a near-fatal accident as he tries to escape.

item.title: Rare Wolf Snake with two heads which fight each other for food is discovered in India
item.description: The extremely rare two-headed Wolf Snake was discovered by photographer Rakesh Mohalick in the Keonjhar wildlife sanctuary in Odisha State, eastern India.

item.title: Photographer captures strangers who look so similar they could have been separated at birth
item.description: Francois Brunelle, from Quebec, has always been fascinated by doppelgangers and has spent 16 years on his I'm Not a Look-Alike Project which features identical strangers.

item.title: Hunt for 'senseless' graffiti yobs after London war memorial is vandalised with permanent marker
item.description: A member of the public in north-west London spotted the damage on the memorial in Church Road in Hayes on Monday, May 4. Officers are asking anyone who recognises the writing to call in.

item.title: The Repair Shop widower breaks down in tears
item.description: British widower Albert Thompson broke down in tears on The Repair Shop after he was reunited with a radio that he had bought with his late wife, Eileen. The couple had bought the radio in the 1950s.

item.title: Hundreds of angry customers slam Groupon after being refused cash refunds when orders didn't arrive
item.description: Dad-of-two Matthew Williams forked out £350 for a new double bed for his daughter (both pictured) but when it didn't arrive the company refused to refund him, offering 'Groupon credits'.

item.title: Dog reunited with his owner's girlfriend for the first time after Italy eases its lockdown rules
item.description: Jessica Cristofolini, 24, from Italy was able to visit her boyfriend Fabrizio Bottamedi, 27, on Monday as lockdown restrictions eased. His dog Aly could not contain her joy when she entered the gate.

item.title: Health bosses accuse ministers of 'breaking PPE promises'
item.description: Health bosses today slammed the government for 'breaking promises' to frontline workers over the supply of PPE after it emerged a shipment of 400,000 gowns from Turkey is useless.

item.title: Father, 40, attacked his children and slit their throats, inquest hears
item.description: Nineteen-month-old Pavinya Nithiyakumar and three-year-old Nigish Nithiyakumar died after suffering knife wounds at their home in Ilford, east London on Sunday, April 26.

item.title: Virgin Media and O2 will merge to create a new £31billion media and telecoms giant
item.description: Virgin Media and O2 will merge to create a new £31billion media and telecoms giant, their parent firms have announced today.

item.title: Bear drops down from a balcony after trying to break through a window
item.description: The incident took place in the town of Calliano, in the northern Italian region of Trentino-Alto Adige Sudtirol and the videos were shared by the town's Mayor Lorenzo Conci.

item.title: Pret A Manger will reopen 71 more stores for takeaway and delivery from May 11
item.description: The cafe chain temporarily closed all stores on March 21 prior to the lockdown, but has been gradually opening sites across the country for takeaway and delivery.

item.title: Sickening moment gang mow down four-year-old girl and her grandfather
item.description: A family had been out walking when they were surrounded by bike riders breaking lockdown on playing fields in Doncaster, South Yorkshire. The grandfather is hurled out of shot in a collision.

item.title: Stoke boy, six, saves his pregnant mother and unborn sister's life by using iPad to call for help
item.description: Max Lewis, six, came to his mother Nicky's rescue when she fell ill at their house in Stoke-on-Trent. He called his aunt, Sonia, to tell her his mother, 31, was 'breathing funny' and she called 999.

item.title: DNA decoding solves mystery of volcano-dwelling iron-shelled snail
item.description: The mystery of the volcano-dwelling snail and its iron shell has been unravelled by scientists after its genome was decoded for the first time.

item.title: Immigration drives up UK population by an 'eye-watering' 361,000
item.description: Despite the increase, Britain's population grew at its slowest rate for 15 years between the middle of 2018 and 2019 due to the lowest number of births for 14 years.

item.title: Indonesian man left in constant pain after facial 'birthmark' grew into enormous tumour
item.description: Andriadi Putra, 34, from Medan in North Sumatra, Indonesia, has trouble eating and talking because of the 'trunk' like tumour weighing around 88lbs. Putra suffers from Neurofibromatosis.

item.title: Shocking moment eight 'brain dead' bikers ride the WRONG way down a dual carriageway
item.description: Joe Broadway had just been to drop some food off at his child's house in Tilbury, Essex, on Sunday and was travelling down the A1089 near Grays, Essex when he saw the bikers.

item.title: Brits SHOULD be wearing face masks to help prevent spread of Covid-19, public health academic claims
item.description: Speaking during an online interview with Dr Jen Hough of Liverpool Hope University, Professor John Ashton CBE was critical of the government's response to coronavirus, pointing to a slow initial reaction.

item.title: Cancer-stricken girl, 4, breaks down in tears as she is finally reunited with dad in touching clip
item.description: Mila Sneddon, from Falkirk, Scotland, stole the hearts of the nation when she was seen kissing her father Scott, 50, through a glass window at the start of the UK's lockdown.

item.title: Are you dreaming of a country house like this in lockdown?
item.description: House hunters crave bigger home and prize open green spaces more than before, due to lockdown, according to a new survey by Savills.

item.title: Jennifer Garner thanks friend Meghan Markle for 'sharing her son Archie with the world'
item.description: In an open letter shared on Instagram, Jennifer Garner, 48, thanked Meghan, 38, and Prince Harry, 35, for sharing a family video to support Save the Children's Save with Stories campaign.

item.title: How will Britain pay its furlough and coronavirus bill?
item.description: Britain has been busily taking on its own emergency loans to deal with coronavirus. What do we do to pay all this extra borrowing off?

item.title: Sydney mother makes potato skins into hot chips by coating them in oil and crisping in an air fryer
item.description: Sydney woman Mary Daly coated a pile of potato peels in olive oil and salt, and fried them in an air fryer for 20 minutes until they crisped into thin hot chips.

item.title: Former Princess Tessy of Luxembourg shares a glimpse at her wholesome family life in lockdown
item.description: Former Princess Tessy of Luxembourg, 34, wed Louis in 2006, and has two children Prince Gabriel of Nassau, 13, and Prince Noah of Nassau, 11, with the Prince, and the family are based in London.

item.title: How good is YOUR spelling?
item.description: Veteran quiz creator Terry Stein shared a 50-question version of the test on the US-based website Playbuzz. Here, FEMAIL shares the first 20 to get you started.

item.title: Mother is 'praying there is long enough to save' her daughter who can barely get out of bed
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Evie Toombes, 18, from Skegness, was born with spina bfida and suffers from gastropersis. She was due to have a critical surgery in March, but it was cancelled.

item.title: Gas leak at Indian chemical plant leaves at least eight dead
item.description: Toxic gas which leaked from a plastics factory in the city of Vishakhapatnam, India, on Thursday morning killed at least eight people, put 100 in hospital and left 1,000 with breathing difficulties.

item.title: Shocking moment man, 21, filming himself on Facebook Live is shot and killed by cops
item.description: The wild incident unfolded on Wednesday in Indianapolis after officers began pursuing a vehicle that was driving erratically. Family members identified the victim as 21-year-old Sean Reed.

item.title: TikTok user claims best way to poach an egg is in the MICROWAVE
item.description: A young Australian woman uploaded a video to TikTok of herself attempting to cook eggs similar to the poached version found inside Macca's breakfast burgers

item.title: Interns reveal what REALLY happens behind closed doors
item.description: Interns from around the world having taken to anonymous app Whisper to reveal what really happens behind the scenes of a working day - including hiring escorts for their boss.

item.title: Baby becomes first boy to be born in Polish village for TEN YEARS
item.description: Baby Bartek, pictured, is the first boy to be born in a small Polish villiage since 2010. His mother said he was a double miracle after also need a live-saving operation. The Mayor of the village is delighted.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on… Professor Lockdown
item.description: 'Put simply, I failed to follow my own advice'

item.title: Sadiq Khan uses Covid crisis to roll-out 'fast-track' transformation of city's roads
item.description: Boris Johnson today said the coronavirus pandemic could signal a 'golden age' for cycling, amid warnings passenger numbers on the Tube will have to be reduced to around 13 per cent of pre-crisis levels.

item.title: Hundreds of non-recyclable fiberglass wind turbine blades are pictured piling up in landfill
item.description: The municipal landfill in Casper, Wyoming, is the repository of at least 870 discarded blades, and one of the few locations in the country that accepts the massive fiberglass objects.

item.title: Elon Musk leads US anger at 'hypocritical' 'Professor Lockdown' Neil Ferguson
item.description: Professor Neil Ferguson, 51, of Imperial College London, forecast grim coronavirus death tolls in the UK and US if their governments remained squeamish about social distancing.

item.title: Brit couple spend lockdown living in a transit van in Spain with two young children
item.description: Pete Russell, 27, originally from Long Eaton, and his wife Hannah, 25, from Bingham, decided to leave England for sunnier climates after a series of tragic events, which involved losing a child.

item.title: Video shows a professional surfer's daring ride down a storm drain in Hawaii
item.description: Professional surfer Jamie O'Brien posted the stellar video to YouTube in April, showing him and his friends surfing down a storm drain in Hawaii.

item.title: Europe's East-West divide on coronavirus cases after eastern countries close borders
item.description: Experts say the vulnerability of health systems in Eastern Europe spurred leaders into decisive action while governments in the west felt a 'greater sense of complacency'.
